docs.snippet: LONDON, July 22 (AP)--A ship identified as the 1,282-ton Frossoula, of Panama registry, was sunk by German bombers last week, an authoritative source said today, adding that it was feared there was a "heavy loss of life."
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, July 22 (AP)--A ship identified as the 1,282-ton Frossoula, of Panama registry, was sunk by German bombers last week, an authoritative source said today, adding that it was feared there was a "heavy loss of life."
docs.abstract: Panama SS Frossoula sunk by German bombers on July 15 off Spanish coast; 3 survivors reach Brit port; SS Panamanian rescued survivors; Brit destroyer Brazen sunk by German planes; shoots down 3; comment on Brit destroyer losses; Brit Navy reptd stronger now than at war start

headline.main: PANAMA SHIP SUNK; NAZIS ARE BLAMED; London Reports Bombing Off Cape Finisterre--Captain and Many Others Lost . SOME OF CREW ARE SAVED Frossoula Was Third Vessel of American Registry to Be Lost During the War

docs.snippet: Because of the rainfall in various sections of the city Monday night, with the resultant small attendance at Lewisohn Stadium, the Philharmonic-Symphony Orchestra and Robert Casadesus, the distinguished French pianist, gave a repeat performance of...
docs.lead_paragraph: Because of the rainfall in various sections of the city Monday night, with the resultant small attendance at Lewisohn Stadium, the Philharmonic-Symphony Orchestra and Robert Casadesus, the distinguished French pianist, gave a repeat performance of the program last night.

headline.main: CASADESUS PLAYS AT STADIUM AGAIN; French Pianist Appears With Philharmonic in Works by Liszt and Mozart

docs.snippet: Arturo Toscanini, saddened by the death of a member of his 100-piece National Broadcasting Company orchestra, returned with his organization yesterday on the liner Uruguay of the American Republics Line.
docs.lead_paragraph: Arturo Toscanini, saddened by the death of a member of his 100-piece National Broadcasting Company orchestra, returned with his organization yesterday on the liner Uruguay of the American Republics Line.

headline.main: Toscanini Returns From His Tour Saddened by the Death of a Player; News of Tragedy in South America Withheld From Conductor Till Liner Nears Port --Maestro May Take Trip West

docs.snippet: Dr. John R. Mott, president of the International Missionary Council and of the World's Committee of the Y.M.C.A., said yesterday on his return from South America that the people of the United States should make every effort to convince South...
docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. John R. Mott, president of the International Missionary Council and of the World's Committee of the Y.M.C.A., said yesterday on his return from South America that the people of the United States should make every effort to convince South Americans that we are not only willing but able to make the Monroe Doctrine effective.

headline.main: UNITY WITH LATINS URGED BY J.R. MOTT; Y.M.C.A. Leader, Back From South America, Says U.S. Must Stress Protective Aim SYMPATHY IS FOR ALLIES But Missionary Chief Asserts Monroe Doctrine Policy Should Be Convincing

docs.snippet: HAVANA, July 23--The machinery by which the American republics could take over any Western Hemisphere possession of any European country in case of its attempted transfer to other non-American sovereignty was rapidly taking shape today. There were...
docs.lead_paragraph: HAVANA, July 23--The machinery by which the American republics could take over any Western Hemisphere possession of any European country in case of its attempted transfer to other non-American sovereignty was rapidly taking shape today. There were increasing signs that this problem would be the outstanding one during the second consultative meeting of American Foreign Ministers.

headline.main: NAZI RULE BARRED; Any of Americas Could Start Machinery to Be Set Up at Havana LOOPHOLE FOR ARGENTINA Only Nations Ratifying Plan to Participate--None Can Acquire Sovereignty
